Admin / Accounts Officer Job at Good Neighbours Microfinance Bank




        
    

        
        Good Neighbours Microfinance Bank is Licensed by the Central Bank of Nigeria to render financial services to Nigerians in accordance with the CBN policy. Good Neighbours MFB has tirelessly set the pace for other Microfinance Institutions through distinguished service quality, product functionality and exceptional customer service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: SME Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify and pursue new business opportunities.
	Provide strategic and marketing plans to enable the attainment of GN MFB Revenue and profitability goals.
	Develop and maintain a strong pipeline of deals, meeting monthly and quarterly targets.
	Provide prompt response to customer enquiries on products or existing account queries.
	Monitor and manage existing loan portfolios to ensure timely repayment and mitigate credit risk.
	Keeps management informed by submitting activity reports, such as daily call reports, weekly and monthly work plans.
	Perform other tasks as assigned by the Team Lead.


Requirements / Qualification


	Candidates should possess an HND/B.Sc Degree in Marketing or any other relevant course of study.
	Minimum of 3 years of work experience in SME banking in a microfinance institution.
	Proven track record of successfully sourcing and closing business loans, a quality portfolio.
	Good interpersonal relationship and analytical skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment as well as meet deadlines.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@gnmfb.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Admin / Accounts Officer Job at Medife Limited

Job Position: Admin / Accounts Officer
Job Location: Lagos Island, Lagos

	Assist in recording daily financial transactions
	Support bank reconciliations and expense tracking
	Manage filing, documentation, and general office administration
	Prepare invoices, receipts, and payment vouchers
	Maintain petty cash and expense records
	Support HR/admin tasks as needed

	NYSC experience in finance/admin can be accepted
	Experience handling petty cash, invoicing, filing, and document management is a
	Plus.

	Basic knowledge of bookkeeping and accounting principles
	Ability to use accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Tally) – added advantage
	Proficiency in MS tools
	Good administrative and organizational skills
